captions.text:
00:03
Rich: Hi, my name’s Rich Weissencell, and
these are my DeLoreans.

00:20
COMM: From a limousine to a hover-craft and

even a monsters truck - Rich Weissensel has
taken his DeLorean obsession to a new level.

00:29
Rich: Crazy? Absolutely, I would say without
a doubt DeLorean crazy.

00:34
COMM: Rich, from Chicago, began creating his

radical custom cars after meeting founder
John DeLorean 14-years ago.

00:42
Rich: I met John DeLorean at one of the DeLorean

car shows. I showed him some of my sketches
and I told him I’d like to build something

like this, and probably thought I was a little
bit crazy but he said of you think you can
do it, go for it.

00:56
COMM: Inspired, the 50-year-old set about

turns his creations into a reality, starting
with the biggest of them all.

01:03
Rich: This is my DeLorean Monster Truck, and

this is what it sounds like when I fire it
up.

01:14
Rich: Even though it’s pretty big it actually

only took me a month to build it. Uh built
it back in 2002, using a wrecked DeLorean
and a wrecked K5 Blazer.

01:25
Rich: Uh we married the two bodies together,

body and chassis and uh we did some upgrades,
including a 12 inch lift kit.

01:36
COMM: And the building didn’t stop there,

as Rich new creations came in all shapes and
sizes.

01:40
Rich: T he DeLorean Limousine is 26 feet long,

it’s got three sets of gull wing doors,
so we have six fully operational gull wing

doors on there, and that’s never been attempted
as far as I know on any kind of limousine.

01:52
Rich: Probably for good reason, they’re

very difficult to try to get everything lined
up exactly right.

02:00
COMM: He maybe aggressive with his designs,

but Rich employs a code of conduct - the DeLorean
enthusiast will only use damaged cars for
his creations.

02:09
Rich: I use them primarly because there is

so few deloreans actually built that I did
not want to remove the good ones from the

population so I wait till I get damaged cars
and I use them for the project, as I come
up with them.

02:27
COMM: As Rich drives his DeLorean into the

distance he’s already planning his next
amazing car conversion.

02:34
Rich: My delorean projects are kinda like
kids so it’s difficult to pick a favourite.

02:40
Rich: I have so many different ideas for custom

deloreans, I’m not sure if time, money or
my eventual age stops me from building them

but uh as long as I’m able I’ll continue
to build them.

title: Man Transforms 'Back To The Future' Cars Into Bizarre Creations
